data.enText: the opportunity or ability to do or achieve sth
There's still plenty of scope for improvement.

data.chText: 有了这笔额外资金，我们就能把设备加以改进了。
data.enText: The extra money will give us the scope to improve our facilities.

data.chText: 干着那样的工作，她几乎没有机会得到提拔。
data.enText: Her job offers very little scope for promotion.

data.chText: 你先试着做一件自己力所能及的事。
data.enText: First try to do something that is within your scope .
the range of things that a subject, an organization, an activity, etc. deals with
Our powers are limited in scope .

data.chText: 这一问题超出了我们的考察范围。
data.enText: This subject lies beyond the scope of our investigation.

data.chText: 这些问题不属本文论述范围。
data.enText: These issues were outside the scope of the article.
an instrument for looking through or watching sth with
to look at or examine sth thoroughly

data.chText: 他环顾房间四周，想在人群中找到她。
data.enText: His eyes scoped the room, trying to spot her in the crowd.
to look at sth carefully in order to see what it is like

simple_means.memory_skill: scop 观察；镜 + e → 观察的范围 → 眼界

ex.chText: 这款游戏适合学龄前儿童。
ex.enText: This game is suitable for children in the pre-school age range.

ex.chText: 那家公司多数员工的薪水在3000元到5000元之间。
ex.enText: Most workers in that company earn a salary in the range of 3000 yuan to 4000 yuan.
This coat is out of my price range.

ex.chText: 她阅读的书籍涉及诸多学科。
ex.enText: Her reading covers a wide range of subjects.

synonyms.bx: 指数、量、年龄等的范围，常后接具体的上下限额。

ex.chText: 实际上，他是个金融领域的投机者。
ex.enText: In fact, he is an adventurer in the financial field.

ex.chText: 他在自己的领域里已经大名鼎鼎了。
ex.enText: He has become very famous in his own field.
She works in the field of environmental protection.
Who is the expert in that field?

ex.chText: 警方首先要界定调查范围。
ex.enText: The police had to first define the scope of the investigation.

ex.chText: 对后殖民主义问题的讨论不在本书范围之内。
ex.enText: A discussion of post-colonial issues is beyond the scope of this book.

synonyms.bx: 指学科、活动、书籍等的范围，也指不同的活动圈子。

data.enText: to look at sth carefully in order to see what it is like

tr: electronic equipment that provides visual images of varying electrical quantities
a magnifier of images of distant objects
an area in which something acts or operates or has power or control: "the range of a supersonic jet"
example: a piano has a greater range than the human voice
within the compass of this article
within the scope of an investigation
outside the reach of the law
in the political orbit of a world power

tr: the state of the environment in which a situation exists
example: you can't do that in a university setting

value.def: If there is scope for a particular kind of behaviour or activity, people have the opportunity to behave in this way or do that activity.

example.ex: He believed in giving his staff scope for initiative...
example.tran: 他认为应给员工提供发挥主动性的机会。

example.ex: Banks had increased scope to develop new financial products.
example.tran: 银行已为开发新的金融产品留出了更大余地。

value.def: The scope of an activity, topic, or piece of work is the whole area which it deals with or includes.

example.ex: Mr Dobson promised to widen the organisation's scope of activity.
example.tran: 多布森先生许诺拓宽该组织的活动范围。

partsOfSpeech.dec: helio 太阳 + scop 观察；镜 + e → 太阳望远镜
macro 宏伟，大 + scop 观察；镜 + ic 某种药 → 从宏伟的角度观察 → 宏观的
scop 观察；镜 + e → 观察的范围 → 眼界
tele 远 + scop 观察；镜 + e → 望远镜
